resources.string: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineering (IEEE) is an International organization which has been the nexus for propagating scientific expertise among people all over the globe. IEEE continues to attract students, faculties and professionals from various fields all around the world and is committed to incorporating diversity in thoughts which is essential for scientific developement. IEEE serves as a hub to many engineering students and express their technical acuity to the world and has always been at the forefront of the technical revolution

PICT IEEE Student Branch (PISB) was established in the year 1988 with an aim of inculacating a sense of technical awareness amongst its student members. PISB aims to escalae the knowledge and trends in the diverse fields of technologies amongst its members. PISB upholds two major events every year - Credenz and Credenz Tech Dayxz with the first one being conducted in odd semester and the later one in the even semester. PISB is also marked by its Women in Engineering (WIE) chapter, an initiative for the empowerment of women.
Q. What is the IEEE membership fee?
Q. What is the duration of the membership?
Q. There\'s too many people working, would everyone be good enough to learn in the span of 3 months?
Q. What are the benefits I can avail from this membership?
Q. What other activities are part of IEEE, apart from Credenz?
A. The membership fee for PISB is 940/-. You can talk to anyone from the \'Contact Us\' section regarding the registration process.
A. The membership will last for 6 months. You will recieve a mail from ieeecontact.org regarding the membership.
A. Credenz is a huge event. To make this event successful, PISB requires a large number of members.

A. PISB membership gives you direct access to all learning materials available on the international IEEE reposotories, along with the benefit of the extensive network of faculty and seniors students to guide you.

A. PISB stays active throughout the year with several events besides Credenz, such as CTD and SIGs, Apart from that members also come together on personal projects in various fields ranging from competitive coding to machine learning.
